{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3287226,"name":"Justin | 6925 Alumentor","username":"BTYWAR","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/btywar/{size}/191771_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-17T21:22:46.062Z","cooked":"

I formatted and updated the roborio and reprogrammed the radio. On the FRC driver station when I connect to the robot comms shows up. However when I connect using Tuner X none of the motors show up despite them being properly electrically connected and flashing the right colors. Does anyone know why?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2024-01-17T21:22:46.062Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":183,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":948.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450717,"topic_slug":"no-devices-showing-up-on-tuner-x","display_username":"Justin | 6925 Alumentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56061,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/no-devices-showing-up-on-tuner-x/450717/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3287249,"name":"","username":"crazrRobot123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crazrrobot123/{size}/211176_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-17T21:52:03.011Z","cooked":"

I believe that you have to upload code to the RoboRIO with the phoenix dependency installed or just start a Temporary Diagnostics Server in Tuner X.

Phoenix 6

Connecting Tuner

Installed onto the robot controller (either manually or via a robot program) is the Phoenix Diagnostics Server. This program enables communication between Tuner X and the robot controller for manag...

I ran a temporary diagnostics server but nothing showed up. We think it has something to do with roborio because it gives the error of roborio can not be found when trying to deploy code. However there does not seem like there are any updates or anything and we think its formatted correctly.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Imaging your roboRIO 2

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

When we click the SD folder icon, this is what pops up. We tried going into the SD images folder and extracting the disk image file but that also did not work.
IMG_17281920×1543 633 KB

etcher.balena.io

balenaEtcher - Flash OS images to SD cards & USB drives

A cross-platform tool to flash OS images onto SD cards and USB drives safely and easily. Free and open source for makers around the world.

We had a similar problem a bit ago. Check that all your firmware on all hardware connected are updated and then update your code. Our issue ended up being that the Spark MAXs didnt have their firmware updated and that was repeatedly crashing the code. The temporary diagnostic server usually does not work.
